Jul 30, 2018

About Me

Posted in About

“There are only two questions really worth asking. Why are we here? And what should we do about it while we are?” John Lloyd.

I have no idea why we are here. But I want to merge my background in astrophysics and particle physics to observe and model the universe. I am obsessed with physics and I want to infect the next generation. Ultimately, I want to be a professor. Presently, I’m a PhD student at the University of Hawaii and a collaborator on DUNE. Before joining DUNE, I modeled sterile neutrinos in the early universe.

Hey, there. I’m Alex. I’m a PhD student at the University of Hawaii. I earned my BS in Astrophysics at UCSD and my MS at SDSU. Why is there more matter than antimatter? What is dark matter? I'm trying to find out. I’m currently working on DUNE. Check out my CV. In short, I love physics & teaching. Send me an email. I’m also on 500px.
